episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the use of condoms in military operations, the frequency of star explosions in the universe, the culinary practices of ancient Mexican cannibals, and a humorous loophole involving a dog at Cambridge University.

facts.fact: As part of the preparation for the D-Day landings, the Allies used condoms to collect soil and sand from the Normandy beaches.
Every second, a star in the universe explodes.
The Tlatelolco cannibals of ancient Mexico ate human flesh with chili sauce.
Dogs aren't allowed at Selwyn College in Cambridge, so the master's basset hound has been reclassified as a very large cat.
